verses.plain: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.

tokens.t: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.

verses.plain: And the name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.

tokens.t: And the name of the man
Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.

verses.plain: And Elimelech Naomi’s husband died; and she was left, and her two sons.

tokens.t: And Elimelech Naomi’s husband died; and she was left, and her two sons.

verses.plain: And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about ten years.

tokens.t: And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one
Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about ten years.

verses.plain: And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.

tokens.t: And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.

verses.plain: ¶ Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the LORD had visited his people in giving them bread.

tokens.t: ¶ Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the
had visited his people in giving them bread.

verses.plain: Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.

tokens.t: Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.

verses.plain: And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law, Go, return each to her mother’s house: the LORD deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.

tokens.t: And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law, Go, return each to her mother’s house: the
deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.

verses.plain: The LORD grant you that ye may find rest, each of you in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice, and wept.

tokens.t: The
grant you that ye may find rest, each
in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice, and wept.

verses.plain: And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.

tokens.t: And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.

verses.plain: And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me? are there yet any more sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?

tokens.t: And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me?
there yet
sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?

verses.plain: Turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should have an husband also to night, and should also bear sons;

tokens.t: Turn again, my daughters, go
for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope,
I should have an husband also to night, and should also bear sons;

verses.plain: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from having husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the LORD is gone out against me.

tokens.t: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from having husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the
is gone out against me.

verses.plain: And they lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother in law; but Ruth clave unto her.

tokens.t: And they lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother in law; but Ruth clave unto her.

verses.plain: And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

tokens.t: And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

verses.plain: And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God:

tokens.t: And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee,
to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people
my people, and thy God my God:

verses.plain: Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the LORD do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and me.

tokens.t: Where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried: the
do so to me, and more also,
but death part thee and me.

verses.plain: When she saw that she was stedfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.

tokens.t: When she saw that she was stedfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.

verses.plain: ¶ So they two went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said, Is this Naomi?

tokens.t: ¶ So they two went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said,
this Naomi?

verses.plain: And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi, call me Mara: for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.

tokens.t: And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi, call me Mara: for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.

verses.plain: I went out full, and the LORD hath brought me home again empty: why then call ye me Naomi, seeing the LORD hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?

tokens.t: I went out full, and the
hath brought me home again empty: why
call ye me Naomi, seeing the
hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?

verses.plain: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Beth-lehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

tokens.t: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Beth-lehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

footnotes.text: should have…: or were with an husband
it grieveth…: Heb. I have much bitterness
Intreat…: or, Be not against me
